summary: This document is an email chain between US Attorney's Office personnel discussing updates in the Jeffrey Epstein probate case. It covers the filing of the estate's verified inventory valuing assets at approximately $635 million, disputes between the estate executors and the Virgin Islands Attorney General over victim compensation and estate funds, and legal actions taken by the Virgin Islands AG.

locations: Epstein's two islands (in the Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's estate is valued at approximately $635 million according to a verified inventory filed in March 2020.

The Virgin Islands Attorney General, Denise George, has brought charges against the estate and alleged that Epstein's lawyers/executors, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.
The Virgin Islands AG has placed liens on Epstein's estate assets, freezing bank accounts and demanding oversight of all expenditures, which the executors are contesting.

The AG has demanded conditions for a victim compensation program, including estate cooperation with investigations, waiving NDAs for former employees, and excluding executors from the program's administration.
Epstein modified his will two days before his death to have it executed in the US Virgin Islands, naming Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn as executors.
